channel.title: Wcf on juri.strumpflohner
channel.description: Recent content in Wcf on juri.strumpflohner

item.title: HowTo: Using VS2010 Web.config Transformations to Bypass SSL Authentication Locally
item.description: Most often when you create WCF webservices you'll want to run them in a secure channel, for instance by using SSL encryption on the transport level.

item.title: Intercepting WCF Operation Calls with Impersonated Identity
item.description: Take the following scenario. You have a WCF webservice with several operations. The communication runs within a secure SSL channel and uses Kerberos authentication. The webservice application runs with an assigned application pool user, in your .

item.title: ASP.net Ajax: Consuming webservice from client-side JavaScript
item.description: Yesterday I answered a question on SO related to the problem of consuming an ASP.net webservice from JavaScript on the client-side. So I thought it might be a good idea to put it down in a downloadable example that can be used as a starting point for all those that didn't yet use this method.
